org.gradoop.flink.model.api.epgm

Interface BaseGraphOperators<G extends GraphHead,V extends Vertex,E extends Edge,LG extends BaseGraph<G,V,E,LG,GC>,GC extends BaseGraphCollection<G,V,E,LG,GC>>

  • Type Parameters:
    G - The graph head type.
    V - The vertex type.
    E - The edge type.
    LG - The type of the graph.
    GC - The type of the graph collection.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    BaseGraph<G,V,E,LG,GC>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LogicalGraph

    public interface BaseGraphOperators<G extends GraphHead,V extends Vertex,E extends Edge,LG extends BaseGraph<G,V,E,LG,GC>,GC extends BaseGraphCollection<G,V,E,LG,GC>>
    Defines the operators that are available on a BaseGraph.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default LG aggregate(AggregateFunction... aggregateFunctions)
      Applies the given aggregate functions to the base graph and stores the result of those functions at the resulting graph using the given property keys.
      LG callForGraph(BinaryBaseGraphToBaseGraphOperator<LG> operator, LG otherGraph)
      Creates a base graph from that graph and the input graph using the given binary operator.
      LG callForGraph(UnaryBaseGraphToBaseGraphOperator<LG> operator)
      Creates a base graph using the given unary graph operator.

      Creates a new base graph by combining the vertex and edge sets of this graph and the given graph.

      Creates a copy of the base graph.

      Returns the subgraph that is induced by the edges which fulfill the given filter function.

      Creates a condensed version of the base graph by grouping vertices and edges based on given property keys.

      Creates a condensed version of the base graph by grouping vertices and edges based on given property keys.

      Creates a new base graph containing the overlapping vertex and edge sets of this graph and the given graph.

      default LG reduceOnNeighbors(VertexAggregateFunction function, Neighborhood.EdgeDirection edgeDirection)
      Sets the aggregation result of the given function as property for each vertex.

      Returns a subgraph of the base graph which contains only those vertices and edges that fulfil the given vertex and edge filter functions respectively.

      Returns a subgraph of the base graph which contains only those vertices and edges that fulfil the given vertex and edge filter functions respectively.

    • Method Detail

      • copy

        default LG copy()
        Creates a copy of the base graph.

        Note that this method creates new graph head, vertex and edge instances.

        Returns:
        projected base graph

      • groupBy

        default LG groupBy(List<String> vertexGroupingKeys)
        Creates a condensed version of the base graph by grouping vertices based on the specified property keys.

        Vertices are grouped by the given property keys. Edges are implicitly grouped along with their incident vertices.

        Note: To group vertices by their type label, one needs to add the specific symbol Grouping.LABEL_SYMBOL to the respective grouping keys.

        Parameters:
        vertexGroupingKeys - property keys to group vertices
        Returns:
        summary graph
        See Also:
        Grouping

      • groupBy

        default LG groupBy(List<String> vertexGroupingKeys,
                   List<String> edgeGroupingKeys)
        Creates a condensed version of the base graph by grouping vertices and edges based on given property keys.

        Vertices are grouped by the given property keys. Edges are implicitly grouped along with their incident vertices and explicitly by the specified edge grouping keys.

        One needs to at least specify a list of vertex grouping keys. Any other argument may be null.

        Note: To group vertices/edges by their type label, one needs to add the specific symbol Grouping.LABEL_SYMBOL to the respective grouping keys.

        Parameters:
        vertexGroupingKeys - property keys to group vertices
        edgeGroupingKeys - property keys to group edges
        Returns:
        summary graph
        See Also:
        Grouping

      • groupBy

        default LG groupBy(List<String> vertexGroupingKeys,
                   List<AggregateFunction> vertexAggregateFunctions,
                   List<String> edgeGroupingKeys,
                   List<AggregateFunction> edgeAggregateFunctions,
                   GroupingStrategy groupingStrategy)
        Creates a condensed version of the base graph by grouping vertices and edges based on given property keys.

        Vertices are grouped by the given property keys. Edges are implicitly grouped along with their incident vertices and explicitly by the specified edge grouping keys. Furthermore, one can specify sets of vertex and edge aggregate functions which are applied on vertices/edges represented by the same super vertex/edge.

        One needs to at least specify a list of vertex grouping keys. Any other argument may be null.

        Note: To group vertices/edges by their type label, one needs to add the specific symbol Grouping.LABEL_SYMBOL to the respective grouping keys.

        Parameters:
        vertexGroupingKeys - property keys to group vertices
        vertexAggregateFunctions - aggregate functions to apply on super vertices
        edgeGroupingKeys - property keys to group edges
        edgeAggregateFunctions - aggregate functions to apply on super edges
        groupingStrategy - execution strategy for vertex grouping
        Returns:
        summary graph
        See Also:
        Grouping

      • transform

        default LG transform(TransformationFunction<G> graphHeadTransformationFunction,
                     TransformationFunction<V> vertexTransformationFunction,
                     TransformationFunction<E> edgeTransformationFunction)
        Transforms the elements of the base graph using the given transformation functions. The identity of the elements is preserved.
        Parameters:
        graphHeadTransformationFunction - graph head transformation function
        vertexTransformationFunction - vertex transformation function
        edgeTransformationFunction - edge transformation function
        Returns:
        transformed base graph

      • transformGraphHead

        default LG transformGraphHead(TransformationFunction<G> graphHeadTransformationFunction)
        Transforms the graph head of the base graph using the given transformation function. The identity of the graph is preserved.
        Parameters:
        graphHeadTransformationFunction - graph head transformation function
        Returns:
        transformed base graph

      • transformVertices

        default LG transformVertices(TransformationFunction<V> vertexTransformationFunction)
        Transforms the vertices of the base graph using the given transformation function. The identity of the vertices is preserved.
        Parameters:
        vertexTransformationFunction - vertex transformation function
        Returns:
        transformed base graph

      • transformEdges

        default LG transformEdges(TransformationFunction<E> edgeTransformationFunction)
        Transforms the edges of the base graph using the given transformation function. The identity of the edges is preserved.
        Parameters:
        edgeTransformationFunction - edge transformation function
        Returns:
        transformed base graph

      • vertexInducedSubgraph

        default LG vertexInducedSubgraph(org.apache.flink.api.common.functions.FilterFunction<V> vertexFilterFunction)
        Returns the subgraph that is induced by the vertices which fulfill the given filter function.
        Parameters:
        vertexFilterFunction - vertex filter function
        Returns:
        vertex-induced subgraph

      • edgeInducedSubgraph

        default LG edgeInducedSubgraph(org.apache.flink.api.common.functions.FilterFunction<E> edgeFilterFunction)
        Returns the subgraph that is induced by the edges which fulfill the given filter function.
        Parameters:
        edgeFilterFunction - edge filter function
        Returns:
        edge-induced subgraph

      • subgraph

        default LG subgraph(org.apache.flink.api.common.functions.FilterFunction<V> vertexFilterFunction,
                    org.apache.flink.api.common.functions.FilterFunction<E> edgeFilterFunction)
        Returns a subgraph of the base graph which contains only those vertices and edges that fulfil the given vertex and edge filter functions respectively.

        Note, that the operator does not verify the consistency of the resulting graph. Use verify() for that behaviour.

        Parameters:
        vertexFilterFunction - vertex filter function
        edgeFilterFunction - edge filter function
        Returns:
        base graph which fulfils the given predicates and is a subgraph of that graph

      • subgraph

        default LG subgraph(org.apache.flink.api.common.functions.FilterFunction<V> vertexFilterFunction,
                    org.apache.flink.api.common.functions.FilterFunction<E> edgeFilterFunction,
                    Subgraph.Strategy strategy)
        Returns a subgraph of the base graph which contains only those vertices and edges that fulfil the given vertex and edge filter functions respectively.

        Note, that the operator does not verify the consistency of the resulting graph. Use verify() for that behaviour.

        Parameters:
        vertexFilterFunction - vertex filter function
        edgeFilterFunction - edge filter function
        strategy - execution strategy for the operator
        Returns:
        base graph which fulfils the given predicates and is a subgraph of that graph

      • aggregate

        default LG aggregate(AggregateFunction... aggregateFunctions)
        Applies the given aggregate functions to the base graph and stores the result of those functions at the resulting graph using the given property keys.
        Parameters:
        aggregateFunctions - computes aggregates on the base graph
        Returns:
        base graph with additional properties storing the aggregates

      • reduceOnEdges

        default LG reduceOnEdges(EdgeAggregateFunction function,
                         Neighborhood.EdgeDirection edgeDirection)
        Sets the aggregation result of the given function as property for each vertex. All edges where the vertex is relevant get joined first and then grouped. The relevant edges are specified using the direction which may direct to the vertex, or from the vertex or both.
        Parameters:
        function - aggregate function
        edgeDirection - incoming, outgoing edges or both
        Returns:
        base graph where vertices store aggregated information about connected edges

      • reduceOnNeighbors

        default LG reduceOnNeighbors(VertexAggregateFunction function,
                             Neighborhood.EdgeDirection edgeDirection)
        Sets the aggregation result of the given function as property for each vertex. All vertices of relevant edges get joined first and then grouped by the vertex. The relevant edges are specified using the direction which may direct to the vertex, or from the vertex or both.
        Parameters:
        function - aggregate function
        edgeDirection - incoming, outgoing edges or both
        Returns:
        base graph where vertices store aggregated information about connected vertices

      • verify

        default LG verify()
        Verifies this graph, removing dangling edges, i.e. edges pointing to or from a vertex not contained in this graph.
        This operator can be applied after an operator that has not checked the graphs validity. The graph head of this base graph remains unchanged.
        Returns:
        this graph with all dangling edges removed.

      • verifyGraphContainment

        default LG verifyGraphContainment()
        Verifies this graph, removing dangling graph ids from its elements, i.e. ids different from this graph heads id.
        This operator can be applied after an operator that has not checked the graphs validity. The graph head of this base graph remains unchanged.
        Returns:
        this graph with all dangling graph ids removed.

      • combine

        default LG combine(LG otherGraph)
        Creates a new base graph by combining the vertex and edge sets of this graph and the given graph. Vertex and edge equality is based on their identifiers.
        Parameters:
        otherGraph - base graph to combine this graph with
        Returns:
        base graph containing all vertices and edges of the input graphs

      • overlap

        default LG overlap(LG otherGraph)
        Creates a new base graph containing the overlapping vertex and edge sets of this graph and the given graph. Vertex and edge equality is based on their identifiers.
        Parameters:
        otherGraph - base graph to compute overlap with
        Returns:
        base graph that contains all vertices and edges that exist in both input graphs

      • exclude

        default LG exclude(LG otherGraph)
        Creates a new base graph containing only vertices and edges that exist in that graph but not in the other graph. Vertex and edge equality is based on their identifiers. The graph head of this graph is retained.
        Parameters:
        otherGraph - base graph to exclude from that graph
        Returns:
        base that contains only vertices and edges that are not in the other graph

      • callForGraph

        LG callForGraph(UnaryBaseGraphToBaseGraphOperator<LG> operator)
        Creates a base graph using the given unary graph operator.
        Parameters:
        operator - unary graph to graph operator
        Returns:
        result of given operator

      • callForGraph

        LG callForGraph(BinaryBaseGraphToBaseGraphOperator<LG> operator,
                LG otherGraph)
        Creates a base graph from that graph and the input graph using the given binary operator.
        Parameters:
        operator - binary graph to graph operator
        otherGraph - other graph
        Returns:
        result of given operator
